content:
• Wednesday, May 16, 2012
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com International (NASDAQ:CTRP): Q1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $153M (+18% Y/Y)...

    Ctrip.com International (NASDAQ:CTRP): Q1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $153M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) are trading lower after hours on unconfirmed rumors that the...

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) are trading lower after hours on unconfirmed rumors that the SEC has opened a probe on the company's disclosures. While the company did disclose a formal SEC probe in its May 7th 10Q filing , details may be finally making the rounds. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 17 Comments
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.81M...

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.81M (+12.3% Y/Y) beats by $110M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • LB

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q1 EPS of $0.41 in-line. Revenue of $2.15B (-2.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3%...

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q1 EPS of $0.41 in-line. Revenue of $2.15B (-2.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • VNET

    21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $55M (+71% Y/Y)...

    21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $55M (+71% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • RRGB

    Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (NASDAQ:RRGB): Q1 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $300M (+4.4%...

    Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (NASDAQ:RRGB): Q1 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $300M (+4.4% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -7.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • HOTT

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $172M (+6.4% Y/Y) in-line....

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $172M (+6.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -15.7%), crushed yesterday following its Q1 report (I, II), has plummeted...

    Millennial Media (MM -15.7%), crushed yesterday following its Q1 report (I, II), has plummeted to new post-IPO lows yet again. The post-earnings selloff in fellow mobile ad firm Velti (VELT -34.2%) is likely playing a role, though concerns about Millennial's business have been taking a toll for a while. Jim Edwards recently pointed out that, like Yelp, Millennial's strong Q1 revenue growth was eclipsed by its opex growth, thanks to a major increase in sales headcount.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +8.9%) soars as the company's name has not (yet) been uttered by David Einhorn at...

    Herbalife (HLF +8.9%) soars as the company's name has not (yet) been uttered by David Einhorn at Ira Sohn. More from Einhorn.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • ATVI

    Reports of server connectivity problems for Activision's (ATVI -3%) just-released Diablo 3 are...

    Reports of server connectivity problems for Activision's (ATVI -3%) just-released Diablo 3 are taking a chunk out of shares. According to PC Magazine, ATVI took down the game's servers yesterday at "10:22 a.m. PT for an hour, then from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m., then from 2:15 p.m. PT until 3:30 p.m." This, after ATVI had spent over a decade developing the well-received game.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta (MLM -10.6%) plunges as it gets the David Einhorn treatment at Ira Sohn....

    Martin Marietta (MLM -10.6%) plunges as it gets the David Einhorn treatment at Ira Sohn. Snippets: MLM's CEO is a megalomaniac; the company is overvalued and benefited from a one-time stimulus. Ouch. Vulcan Materials (VMC -6.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • KLAC

    J.P. Morgan's Chris Blansett chops KLA-Tencor (KLAC -4.7%), Lam Research (LRCX -4.5%) and...

    J.P. Morgan's Chris Blansett chops KLA-Tencor (KLAC -4.7%), Lam Research (LRCX -4.5%) and Novellus (NVLS-OLD -4.4%) to Underweight, predicting a "downtick" in capital expenditures by chip foundries in H2 of this year, and that capex in the memory and logic sectors of the business will be lower than many investors expect.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • SFD

    The stocks of a number of meat sellers perk up as the group starts to draw notice from analysts...

    The stocks of a number of meat sellers perk up as the group starts to draw notice from analysts after the latest round of earnings reports came in strong, with improved margins powered by higher retail chicken and beef prices. Also pitching in, the uproar over the pink slime additive used in beef seems to be petering out a bit. Sector movers: Smithfield Foods (SFD +2.2%), Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +3.9%), Sanderson Farms (SAFM +2.4%), Tyson Foods (TSN +1.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • ORIG

    Deutsche Bank initiates Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG -1.7%) at Buy with a $22 price target, believing...

    Deutsche Bank initiates Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG -1.7%) at Buy with a $22 price target, believing ORIG is well positioned to benefit from rising deepwater day rates and limited near-term supply growth. With a fleet of six high quality rigs and an additional three new builds slated for 2013, the firm says ORIG has one of the youngest and most targeted fleets in the industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • EXP

    Eagle Materials (EXP -4.2%) slips after missing FQ4 estimates earlier today. Total revenue...

    Eagle Materials (EXP -4.2%) slips after missing FQ4 estimates earlier today. Total revenue increased 22% Y/Y on improved sales volumes in its cement and paperboard businesses and higher cement, wallboard and paperboard net sales prices, but bottom line margins were hit hard by higher overall material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • AMBO

    Ambow Education Holding (AMBO -17%) , which provides educational and professional development...

    Ambow Education Holding (AMBO -17%) , which provides educational and professional development services in China, delays filing its 2011 annual report beyond the 15-day extension provided by the SEC. The company says it's identified preliminary adjustments to the year's revenue results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -7.2%), no stranger to bad news, plunges to new all-time lows a day after...

    First Solar (FSLR -7.2%), no stranger to bad news, plunges to new all-time lows a day after David Einhorn discloses he liquidated his position in Q1. On the flip side, Expedia (EXPE +3.5%), which Einhorn established a position in, is posting a decent gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +2.2%) reports its Q1 net profit dropped 16% Y/Y as higher sales volumes were...

    Petrobras (PBR +2.2%) reports its Q1 net profit dropped 16% Y/Y as higher sales volumes were offset by lower foreign exchange gains on overseas debt, but EPS of ~$0.36 and revenues (+22% Y/Y) easily beat analyst estimates. Exports rose to 714K bbl/day vs. 631K bbl/day in the year-ago period; demand for gasoline and diesel rose 24% and 9%, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE +4.3%), two months removed from a strong IPO, jumps after Canaccord reiterates...

    Demandware (DWRE +4.3%), two months removed from a strong IPO, jumps after Canaccord reiterates a Buy in the wake of the company's Xchange user conference. The firm likes Demandware's operating leverage and strong revenue growth, and the competitive positioning of its cloud-based e-commerce solutions relative to legacy platforms. NetSuite announced a rival solution yesterday. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +284%) shares shoot into orbit after the microRNA-based molecular...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +284%) shares shoot into orbit after the microRNA-based molecular diagnostic test maker says Novitas, the designated Medicare Administrative Contractor for its miRview® mets² assay, announced it plans to cover the assay for all Medicare beneficiaries.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • VIA

    Shares of Viacom (VIA +3.0%) move up after Eagle Capital's Merly Witmer comes out with positive...

    Shares of Viacom (VIA +3.0%) move up after Eagle Capital's Merly Witmer comes out with positive comments on the name at the Ira Sohn Conference. It won't be the last stock to catch a reaction emanating from the hedge fund manager confab. Still on tap: David Einhorn 3:05 PM EST (HLF?), Bill Ackman 5:30 PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • AMED

    Amedisys (AMED +1.6%) gets a lift as Avondale follows an earlier lead from Baird and upgrades...

    Amedisys (AMED +1.6%) gets a lift as Avondale follows an earlier lead from Baird and upgrades the stock to Market Perform on valuation. The firm also raises its price target from $9.50 to $10.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • GOOG

    A number of Internet stocks are rallying yet again ahead of Facebook's IPO, as expectations grow...

    A number of Internet stocks are rallying yet again ahead of Facebook's IPO, as expectations grow for a strong debut. GOOG +2.6%. YELP +2.5%. P +2.7%. RENN +4.3%. QPSA +2.7%. DMD +6.3%. LNKD +1.8%. However, top Facebook customer Zynga (ZNGA -2.7%) is giving back some of yesterday's gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 8 Comments
  • VELTF

    Though it opened higher after delivering a Q1 beat, Velti (VELT -25%) has since crashed. The...

    Though it opened higher after delivering a Q1 beat, Velti (VELT -25%) has since crashed. The mobile ad agency's Q2 revenue guidance was above Street estimates, but its 2012 guidance of $283M-$296M was only in-line with a $289.5M consensus, and could be disappointing some. Needham (Buy) likes Velti's strong Q1, but notes its cash balance fell 46% Q/Q, and thinks investors want to see an improvement in Velti's revenue collection - trade receivables rose 20% Q/Q to $85.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • TECD

    Goldman says current Q1 Street estimates for Tech Data (TECD -1.6%) are too agressive given...

    Goldman says current Q1 Street estimates for Tech Data (TECD -1.6%) are too agressive given European weakness, and the firm sees risk to 2H revenues. It maintains its EPS estimate of $1.12 on $6.21B in revenue, which is 15% below consensus estimates of $1.17 per share on $6.19B in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR +2.3%) jumps higher despite yesterday's revelation that John Paulson shed his...

    Whirlpool (WHR +2.3%) jumps higher despite yesterday's revelation that John Paulson shed his stake in the company - a move that NBG's Brian Sozzi tweets is telling based on the company's "durable competitive advantages." Today's minor run in share price has been helped by a strong presentation by management at a JPMorgan homebuilding conference that includes a reiteration of full-year EPS at $6.50-$7.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +4.3%) is adding to this week's huge pre and post-earnings rally, undoubtedly...

    Groupon (GRPN +4.3%) is adding to this week's huge pre and post-earnings rally, undoubtedly boosted by short-covering. The gains come as AllThingsD reports Groupon has hired Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) payments chief Vinayak Hegde to be its VP of engineering. Hegde joins several other former Amazon execs at Groupon, including CFO Jason Child, product VP Jeff Holden, and Americas VP Kal Raman.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • DRI

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (DRI +4.8%) are on a mystery run higher on heavy volume as peers...

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (DRI +4.8%) are on a mystery run higher on heavy volume as peers wallow to minor gains. Not only did shares set an all-time high, but option activity has spiked as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • CP

    Bill Ackman is building a head of steam toward Canadian Pacific's (CP +3.7%) proxy vote...

    Bill Ackman is building a head of steam toward Canadian Pacific's (CP +3.7%) proxy vote tomorrow, gaining support from shareholder advisories and big institutional investors in his fight to install new board members and replace management. A poll by research firm Brendan Wood says 79% of shareholders holding more than 50% of CP shares support Ackman's nominees.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Micron (MU +5.4%) rallies following a bullish Raymond James note. The firm sees reports of Apple...

    Micron (MU +5.4%) rallies following a bullish Raymond James note. The firm sees reports of Apple securing mobile DRAM capacity at bankrupt Elpida as an "implied endorsement" of Micron's bid for Elpida, and thinks the acquisition could result in a "more strategic relationship" between Apple and Micron. There's certainly no love lost between Apple and current top DRAM supplier Samsung. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX -5.6%) shares take another leg down as S&P downgrades the company's credit...

    Patriot Coal (PCX -5.6%) shares take another leg down as S&P downgrades the company's credit rating to B- from B with a negative outlook, reflecting weaker demand for metallurgical coal in the export market and for thermal coal because of a warmer-than-normal winter. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • RAMP

    Shares of Acxiom (ACXM +2%) move higher after BMO Capital says the company's strategic changes...

    Shares of Acxiom (ACXM +2%) move higher after BMO Capital says the company's strategic changes are beginning to yield positive results. After reviewing it's strong FQ4 results, BMO believes the company is beginning to head in the right direction, and expects revenue to increase throughout FY13.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold (SA +6.2%) shares power higher after reporting a Q1 loss of $1.9M, half the loss...

    Seabridge Gold (SA +6.2%) shares power higher after reporting a Q1 loss of $1.9M, half the loss for the same period last year. SA invested $7.8M in its two principal properties, KSM and Courageous Lake, vs. $6.9M Y/Y. Earlier this week, SA reported KSM net project cash flow (pre-tax) increased by 25% to $20.3B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • KITD

    Though its Q1 results missed estimates and its 2012 revenue guidance of $250M is well below a...

    Though its Q1 results missed estimates and its 2012 revenue guidance of $250M is well below a $310.9M consensus, KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +6.6%) is bouncing off its all-time lows, as investors decide enough bad news is baked in. Also possibly helping is a 13-D from activist investor Costa Brava. The firm discloses it has boosted its stake in KIT, which has seen a management shakeup, to 6.3%, and is nominating 6 members to the company's board.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • LM

    Legg Mason (NYSE:LM) plans to buy back $1.25B of convertible senior notes that KKR (KKR +0.4%)...

    Legg Mason (NYSE:LM) plans to buy back $1.25B of convertible senior notes that KKR (KKR +0.4%) purchased in 2008. Legg Mason will take non-cash charge of $70M-$80M in FQ1 for the early extinguishment of the notes. The company also intends to repurchase $1B in shares. Shares +11.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (LOGI +7.5%) surges a day after CEO Guerrino De Luca gave a fairly upbeat presentation...

    Logitech (LOGI +7.5%) surges a day after CEO Guerrino De Luca gave a fairly upbeat presentation (transcript) at a JPMorgan conference. While admitting Logitech has made bad calls in the past regarding product development, De Luca expressed optimism about his company's attempts to focus on a smaller number of differentiated products, may of which, such as new videoconferencing gear, are now aimed at the enterprise.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN +5.5%) shares surge after reporting its Q1 loss narrowed to $0.11/share from...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN +5.5%) shares surge after reporting its Q1 loss narrowed to $0.11/share from a loss of $0.70 a year ago and a doubling of revenues to $40M. A planned name change shows IVN is now all about Oyu Tolgoi; construction of phase one of the Mongolian copper-gold project was 77.8% complete at the end of Q1 and 82.2% at the end of April.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • WPM

    Macquarie upgrades Silver Wheaton (SLW +1.5%) to Outperform in the wake of lackluster Q1...

    Macquarie upgrades Silver Wheaton (SLW +1.5%) to Outperform in the wake of lackluster Q1 earnings and a stock slide of more than 30% in three months. The firm notes SLW ended the quarter with $1B in cash and $400M in available credit, putting the miner in position to acquire additional silver streams at accretive levels as alternative forms of financing become harder to obtain.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 6 Comments
  • RCPI

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX +6.4%) trade higher after the company announces that it landed a...

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX +6.4%) trade higher after the company announces that it landed a new patent for an improved process for synthesizing anatabine utilizing larger-scale commercial production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • VIEW

    Cogo Group (COGO +10%) jumps after its Q1 EPS beat estimates yesterday. Net earnings fell 70%...

    Cogo Group (COGO +10%) jumps after its Q1 EPS beat estimates yesterday. Net earnings fell 70% Y/Y as margins weakened due to tight credit conditions in China, but investors appear to be taking it in stride, focusing instead on an upbeat sales picture as total revenue soared by over 60% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +5.9%) rides news of an investment for SAC Capital higher. The hedge...

    Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +5.9%) rides news of an investment for SAC Capital higher. The hedge fund manager purchased more than 4.7M shares of GT in Q1 as shares stumbled along on global economic woes and warm weather trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • THQIQ

    Hard-luck THQ (THQI -10.1%) plunges yet again following its FQ4 report. Though results beat...

    Hard-luck THQ (THQI -10.1%) plunges yet again following its FQ4 report. Though results beat estimates, fears continue to grow that the game developer no longer has the scale to compete with larger rivals, following recent missteps. A sub-$1 stock price is also leading to worries THQ will be de-listed. The company is hoping upcoming releases for its Darksiders, WWE, and Saints Row franchises will help drive a turnaround.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • GLBS

    Globus Maritime (GLBS -3%) slips after being downgraded to Hold at Wunderlich, citing limited...

    Globus Maritime (GLBS -3%) slips after being downgraded to Hold at Wunderlich, citing limited upside due to lower charter rate expectations on the back of the company's Q1 results. The firm also cuts its price target to $4.50 from $8.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • OMX

    Shares of OfficeMax (OMX +2.9%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.1%) shrug off a sluggish report (I, II)...

    Shares of OfficeMax (OMX +2.9%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.1%) shrug off a sluggish report (I, II) from rival Staples to trade higher. The pair of companies have a lighter exposure to Europe, possibly helping tip investor sentiment back their way from SPLS.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +2.6%) trades higher after Wisconsin paper The Journal Times reports the CEO of its...

    Cree (CREE +2.6%) trades higher after Wisconsin paper The Journal Times reports the CEO of its Ruud Lighting subsidiary, acquired last year, boasted on Monday his company has been named Wal-Mart's outdoor lighting supplier. He also noted Ruud is already supplying indoor lighting products for some Wal-Mart stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -12.7%) falls sharply after its outlook on FY12 earnings rattle...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -12.7%) falls sharply after its outlook on FY12 earnings rattle investors. The firm's earnings CC is under way (webcast), dominated by the theme that global sales for the retailer will stay challenged.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +13.4%), which had fallen sharply since March, is surging following its Q1 beat, even...

    Sina (SINA +13.4%), which had fallen sharply since March, is surging following its Q1 beat, even though it was accompanied by soft Q2 revenue guidance and a warning it could see additional losses due to its investments in Weibo, which are expected to grow to $160M in 2012 from $110M-$120M last year. An upgrade from Barclays is helping Sina's cause. BofA (Neutral), though worried about margin pressure, is pleased with Sina's efforts to monetize Weibo.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) -25.2% premarket after Q1 revenues declined 46.4% Y/Y to $9.4M,...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) -25.2% premarket after Q1 revenues declined 46.4% Y/Y to $9.4M, including a 58% Y/Y drop in revenue from the sale of forged rolled rings to the wind power industry to $5.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are up as much of Europe turns higher after Angela Merkel appears...

    Market preview: Stock futures are up as much of Europe turns higher after Angela Merkel appears to sooth markets with talk of keeping Greece in the eurozone, and using words like stimulus and not just austerity. The S&P benchmark is +0.5%. J.C. Penney (-15%) is taking an absolute shellacking following its miserable FQ1 report. Later: Fed's Bullard, FOMC minutes
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 4 Comments
  • OSUR

    Premarket gainers: OSUR +30%. COGO +15%. SINA +12%. ABMD +9%. VELT +8%. FTR +6%. Losers: CLNT...

    Premarket gainers: OSUR +30%. COGO +15%. SINA +12%. ABMD +9%. VELT +8%. FTR +6%.
    Losers: CLNT -29%. JCP -15%. TAXI -9%. NBG -8%. ANF -7%. ARNA -6%. WHX -5%. KERX -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • PDCE

    Petroleum Development (PETD) -1.8% premarket after pricing its public offering of 6.5M shares at...

    Petroleum Development (PETD) -1.8% premarket after pricing its public offering of 6.5M shares at a 2.8% discount to its Tuesday closing price. The offering, intended in part to finance the purchase of assets in Colorado's Wattenberg oil and gas field, priced at $26.50/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • FWONA

    Liberty Media (LMCA) upped its holding in Live Nation Entertainment (NYSE:LYV) to 48.7M shares,...

    Liberty Media (LMCA) upped its holding in Live Nation Entertainment (NYSE:LYV) to 48.7M shares, or more than 25% of the concert promotion giant's outstanding shares, from ~20%, according to an SEC filing. Liberty has received regulatory clearance to own as much as 35% of LYV, whose shares are +4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • OSUR

    OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR) +35.3% premarket after an FDA advisory panel's recommendation...

    OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR) +35.3% premarket after an FDA advisory panel's recommendation to let an HIV test be sold in retail stores; test results could be obtained in the home like tests for pregnancy and blood sugar. The panel voted in favor 17-0 twice, on potential benefits outweighing potential risks and on safety and effectiveness. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • TOT

    Total (NYSE:TOT) says it has stopped the natural gas leak at its North Sea Elgin platform by...

    Total (NYSE:TOT) says it has stopped the natural gas leak at its North Sea Elgin platform by pumping heavy mud into the leaking well there, but does not say when output would resume. "Today, a major turning point has been achieved," Total's head of exploration and production says. TOT +2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 1 Comment

  • Off 1.3% to $1,535, gold is at its YTD low and looks to be testing a key support level hit in...

    Off 1.3% to $1,535, gold is at its YTD low and looks to be testing a key support level hit in September and again in December. Beneath that looks to be a lot of air. It's more volatile cousin silver, -2.4% to $27.40, is forming a similar chart pattern.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 15 Comments
  • DNKN

    Argus upgrades Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) to Buy from Hold as it hones in on the company's...

    Argus upgrades Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) to Buy from Hold as it hones in on the company's prospects to see strong domestic and international growth. Analysts also forecast that DNKN will reap benefits from its franchise model. Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • TGT

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) Q1: Comparable-store sales +5.3% Y/Y. Credit card receivable...

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) Q1: Comparable-store sales +5.3% Y/Y. Credit card receivable decreased 6% to $6.1B. Both EBITDA and EBIT margin rates higher. SG&A expense rate falls to 19.9% from 20.4% last year. Sees Q2 EPS of $1.04-$1.14. Raises FY12 EPS guidance to $4.10-$4.30, from $4.05-$4.25. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT): Q1 EPS of $1.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $16.8B (+6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Target (NYSE:TGT): Q1 EPS of $1.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $16.8B (+6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM
  • ANF

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (NYSE:ANF) Q1: Comparable store sales -5% Y/Y, led lower by Europe. Expects same-store sales to fall at a mid-single digits rate.
